description.raw:
We face the problem of having to keep the backward compatibility with gazebo 8.0.0 loading System Plugins using `-g` option. In order to preserve that functionality I've reverted the change made in 8.1.0 and add a new `gui-client-plugin` option including a warning and deprecation on the -g option.

Now if a user load a GUI plugin using `g` would get the following output:
```
jrivero@nium client-11345 $ gazebo -g /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/gazebo-8/plugins/libTimerGUIPlugin.so --verbose
Gazebo multi-robot simulator, version 8.1.0
Copyright (C) 2012 Open Source Robotics Foundation.
Released under the Apache 2 License.
http://gazebosim.org

[Wrn] [GuiIface.cc:191] g/gui-plugin is really loading a SystemPlugin. To load a GUI plugin please use --gui-client-plugin 
Gazebo multi-robot simulator, version 8.1.0
Copyright (C) 2012 Open Source Robotics Foundation.
Released under the Apache 2 License.
http://gazebosim.org

[Msg] Waiting for master.
QWidget: Must construct a QApplication before a QWidget
[Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
[Msg] Publicized address: 192.168.1.33
```
It does not prevent a crash but could help. It implement a better help system, we probably need to follow [@sloretz's suggestion](#!/osrf/gazebo/issues/2279/core-dump-with-gazebo-81-in#comment-37068528).

A possible deprecation mechanism would be to leave this `-g` in place during the whole 8 series and kill the `gui-plugin` option and move the `-g` to `gui-client-plugin` in gazebo9.

title.raw: Added gui-client-plugin option. Leave -g to load System Plugins (issue #2279)
title.html: Added gui-client-plugin option. Leave -g to load System Plugins (issue #2279)

title: Added gui-client-plugin option. Leave -g to load System Plugins (issue #2279)
